question: I take that as a compliment, Colonel. I'll look for you on the field. They have the howitzers.
answer: How many?

question: About a dozen. A man could get lost up there ... Build an army. Hold out a very long time.
answer: Algren-san...Have you seen what happens to the villages that stand In the way of the railroad? That is what will happen to my village if we do not stand and fight. No. We serve the Emperor here.

question: By dying?
answer: Perhaps.

question: At least make it battle, not a suicide.
answer: And what would that accomplish?

question: So m y hair will have a pleasing scent when I meet my ancestors ... ... You do not do this ?
answer: I studied war at a place called West Point. They taught us about a battle called Thermopylae. Three hundred brave warriors held off the king of Persia's army of a million men. For two da ys they made them pay so dearly that the king lost all appetite for further invasion ... I have some thoughts about the battle tomorrow.

question: Do you really think we can defeat them?
answer: I sure as hell want to find out.

question: You believe a man can change his destiny?
answer: No ... But I think a man cannot know his destiny. He can only do what he can, until his destiny is revealed. What does it say?

question: Mr. Graham....
answer: Captain?

question: Would you please stay with the horses?
answer: As you suggest.

question: Mr. Graham ... Take this. Maybe you can use it for your book.
answer: I will.

question: He was Kaishaku ... my trusted friend.
answer: We won't be able to hold them back this time.

question: This is not your battle. You do not have to die here.
answer: I died a long time ago.

question: But now you live again.
answer: Yes.

question: It was not your time.
answer: No. Maybe I survived just to live this one last day. I'll stay.

question: Enlightened One, we should discuss this
answer: Omura, do you know our northern island? There is a small one called Taraku. A rock in the sea. There is nothing there but crabs who have been known to tear a sleeping man apart ... I have had a small house constructed on the island. You will go there now and await our summons.

question: Sir...?
answer: I hereby seize your family's assets and present them as my gift to the people. Further, I have decided to stop the railroad cxpansion into Yoshino.

question: Enlightened One
answer: You have served your function. I have no more need of you ... You can conspire with the crabs now. Remove yourself.

question: Honored Emperor, I do not know wh y you disgrace me.
answer: If your shame is too unbearable ... I offer you this sword. The samurai is not a man now. He is an idea. Tell me how he died.
